A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Hmm\, saw it this afternoon\, and when leaving the cinema felt more than a little confused\, being as after TFA my feeling was "I want more". But the more I think about it\, the more I think it was quite good. Not wow amazing. Just quite good overall.

The Luke-Rey-Kylo Ren thing worked well for me. Snoke not seeing that coming seems quite funny on reflection. There did seem a little too much humour in the movie\, but why take it too seriously? I liked the porgs too (I was dreading them - no more Jar Jars please).

The scenes about the ships running out of fuel creaked quite badly\, and I sat through them wishing for more of the grumpy\, depressed Luke Skywalker. 

The casino subplot was completely pointless other than featuring some cuddly toy horse things and getting two characters into a ludicrous "falling in love" situation (is this star trek or star wars?)

Expectations satisfied? No... but expectations adjusted? Yes.

It's one of those movies to think about after you've seen it. What's wrong with that?
